Key Match Events: Zach LaVine had 35 points, 10 rebounds and eight assists for Chicago, which trailed by 19 before rallying in the fourth quarter.
Coby White made a go-ahead layup with 47 seconds left.
White then drove into the lane and dunked over a late-arriving Wembanyama, delighting the crowd of 18,886 at the United Center.
Chicago used an 11-0 run to trim San Antonio's lead to 79-71 with 5:24 left in the third quarter.
Paul made two foul shots, a pullup jumper and a 3-pointer to extend the Spurs' advantage to 86-73 with 4:18 remaining in the period.
Post-Match Reflections: Won for the fourth time in five games.
Also rallied for a wild 139-126 victory over the New York Knicks on Saturday night.
